intro: Phacelia magellanica var. californica, commonly known as the California phacelia, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. This species is often used in ecological restoration due to its ability to attract pollinators and stabilize soil.
